Name: Relief fragment
Description: This fragment of relief in limestone, which comes from the temple of Hatshepsut at Deir el-Bahari, depicts a divinity with the head of a bird. It is probably a white spoonbill (Platalea leucorodia), a bird with white or pink plumage and with a long beak widening at the end. The identity of the divinity, of which the representation is unique in egyptian iconography, is not known.
